subject: Re: [junit] assertTrue missing from junit.framework
msgSnippet: ... You have an old version of JUnit. Download 3.8.1. FYI: the version of JUnit /you/ have uses the method assert() rather than assertTrue() . The change
messageBody:
jbirtwell wrote:

> Hi,
>
> Newbie question here. I currently downloaded and installed Junit on
> my Windows XP machine. I'm running JDK 1.4.2. I'm trying to run
> the SimpleTest provided by www.junit.org's documentation. But my
> class doesn't compile.

You have an old version of JUnit. Download 3.8.1.

FYI: the version of JUnit /you/ have uses the method "assert()" rather
than "assertTrue()". The change was made to avoid conflicting with the
JDK 1.4 "assert" keyword.
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
